unnormalised: ## Automotive News: EV Charging Gets a Diwali Spark!
normalised: ## Automotive News: Electric Vehicle Charging Gets a Diwali Spark!

unnormalised: Guess what, folks? The EV revolution is getting charged up, literally! Forget range anxiety – things are looking brighter than a Diwali diya.
normalised: Guess what, folks? The Electric Vehicle revolution is getting charged up, literally! Forget range anxiety – things are looking brighter than a Diwali diya.

unnormalised: IIT Madras just announced a new charging tech that promises faster juicing up for your electric rides. Think less waiting, more cruising down the East Coast Road. They're saying it could significantly cut down charging times, maybe even while you grab a plate of piping hot biryani.
normalised: Indian Institute of Technology Madras just announced a new charging tech that promises faster juicing up for your electric rides. Think less waiting, more cruising down the East Coast Road. They're saying it could significantly cut down charging times, maybe even while you grab a plate of piping hot biryani.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Bharat Petroleum (BPCL) is planning to install hundreds more EV charging stations across the country, targeting highways connecting major cities like Delhi and Mumbai. Imagine driving your Tata Nexon EV from Bangalore to Kochi, stopping for a quick top-up without having to reroute.
normalised: Meanwhile, Bharat Petroleum (B P C L) is planning to install hundreds more Electric Vehicle charging stations across the country, targeting highways connecting major cities like Delhi and Mumbai. Imagine driving your Tata Nexon Electric Vehicle from Bangalore to Kochi, stopping for a quick top-up without having to reroute.

unnormalised: And speaking of Kerala, rumors are swirling that several charging companies are gearing up for the Onam rush, anticipating a surge in EV travel during the festival. Apparently, even your neighbourhood Kirana store might soon offer EV charging!
normalised: And speaking of Kerala, rumors are swirling that several charging companies are gearing up for the Onam rush, anticipating a surge in Electric Vehicle travel during the festival. Apparently, even your neighborhood Kirana store might soon offer Electric Vehicle charging!

unnormalised: The future is electric, and it's looking pretty tasty. Let's hope the prices come down soon, though. Charging ain’t cheap, even if it’s faster these days! We’re talking Rs. 10-12 per unit, so plan your trips accordingly. Keep an eye out for new developments - maybe those 500km range EVs are closer than we think!
normalised: The future is electric, and it's looking pretty tasty. Let's hope the prices come down soon, though. Charging ain’t cheap, even if it’s faster these days! We’re talking rupee ten to twelve per unit, so plan your trips accordingly. Keep an eye out for new developments - maybe those five hundred kilometer range Electric Vehicles are closer than we think!
